title: Niall Horan tattoos Roman Kemp's leg - and makes a typo
text:
He's been a member of the world's biggest boy band.

But former One Direction star Niall Horan proved to be not quite as talented with a tattooist's needle as he is at singing as he awkwardly the leg of Capital FM's Roman Kemp on Friday.

The Irish singer, 26, tried to write the name of his new single 'Nice To Meet Ya' on the Capital Breakfast host - but it ended up looking like 'Nice to Melt Ya'.

Ouch: Former One Direction star Niall Horan, 26, proved to be not very talented with a tattooist's needle as he inked the leg of Capital FM's Roman Kemp on Friday

Whoops: The Irish singer, 26, tried to write the name of his new single 'Nice To Meet Ya' on the Capital Breakfast host - but it ended up looking like 'Nice to Melt Ya'

The gaffe prompted cries of horror from Roman, 26, who said: 'Oh my god! It looks like it says "Nice to Melt Ya!"

'You’ve written "Nice to Melt Ya!" on my leg! You’re calling my mum! What the **** is that!?'

Niall had apologised before he even started the tattoo, saying: 'I don’t know how they do this on a regular basis, this is scary!

'I’m so sorry about this in advance, OK?'

Not so good with a needle: The gaffe prompted cries of horror from Roman, 26, following the error

A bit shaky: Niall had apologised before he even started the tattoo, saying: 'I don’t know how they do this on a regular basis, this is scary!

Roman agreed to the tattoo after Niall promised to donate £5,000 toward's the presenter's charity challenge.

It will see him travel 1,000 miles across the UK next week as he hosts five shows in five locations to raise money for Capital's charity initiative Make Some Noise.

It supports small organisations around the UK which are helping children.

Later in the day, Niall revealed to BBC Radio 2's Steve Wright that it is 'great' to now be able to live a 'normal life' by going shopping and using the Tube without being overwhelmed by fans.

He said: 'It’s mad how that now we’re older and our fans have grown up with us, I can literally live a normal life.

He then confirmed that he goes to both the pub and the supermarket before adding: 'Yesterday I walked through Westfield shopping centre in Shepherds Bush and I wouldn’t have been able to do that.

Seeing the funny side: Niall looked triumphant as Roman looked on in horror at the tattoo - but at least it was all for a good cause

It could be worse: Despite the gaffe, Niall is donating £5,000 raise money for Capital's charity initiative Make Some Noise so it's all worth it

'I actually got lost yesterday because I’ve never actually been in there properly. There was a time when you couldn’t walk down the street.'

And when asked by Wright if he caught the Tube to go shopping, he replied: 'I always get the tube.

In response to an incredulous Wright, who appeared not to believe him, he added: 'Yeah I get the tube all the time…I wear a hat to half save myself but for the most part I do what I want. It’s great, honestly!'

It comes after the release of Nice To Meet Ya on Friday, which was his first new music since last year's single Seeing Blind.

The singer-songwriter launched his solo career with his popular debut album Flicker in 2017, two years after One Direction's disbandment.

One Direction had formed in 2010 after the individual band members - Niall, Louis Tomlinson, Harry Styles, Liam Payne and Zayn Malik - auditioned for the British version of The X Factor.
